This 1942 Claret which towers head and shoulders above the regional red wines of Bordeaux is now fully matured and a delight for present day drinking.

B *CHATEAU DUCRU BEAUCAILLOU 1943 (St. Julien) 2.49

One of the biggest and stoutest of the 1943’s—Perhaps even bigger than a Lafitte of the same year. A magnificent wine that will continue to improve with the years.

*CHATEAU LYNCH BAGES 1943 (Pauillac) 2.86

Considered one of the best vineyards of the Medoc. In a great vintage year, such as 1943, it is rich, fine, full, with a distinguished after-taste. An irresistible opportunity for those who want truly great Claret at modest cost.

*CHATEAU MOUTON D’/ARMAILHACQ 1943 (Pauillac) 2.86

This Chateau is adjacent to Mouton Rothschild and is also the property of the Rothschild family. Delicate, polished and aristocratic, it is a beautiful wine to drink today.

*CHATEAU RAUZAN-GASSIES 1937 (Margaux) 4.13

*CHATEAU LEOVILLE LASCASES 1937 (st. Julien) 4.51

No longer commercially available, this magnificent 1937 was one of the most successful wines produced during this extremely great vintage. Now over a decade in the bottle, it has acquired great mellowness and charm.

The 1942 vintage proved more successful in Sauternes than in any other wine growing district in France. It possesses all the richness, lusciousness and finesse associated with great Sauternes.
